title: For Graye & M
name: For Graye & M
description:
A Map by Jenniever

Places we'd like Graye &amp; M to eat and see when they come on east

properties.name: Century 21 Department Stores
properties.description: Posted by Jenniever 22 Cortlandt St, New York, NYRight across from the hole - great bargains on designer (real designer) wear. Leave some room in your suitcase!

properties.name: Empire State Building
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing empire state building102 floors, 1252 feet, 381 meters high. Effective use of setbacks to emphasize tower.

properties.name: La Isla
properties.description: Posted by Jenniever Some really painfully great Cuban food made by a three-star New York chef.

properties.name: Les Halles
properties.description: Posted by Jenniever 411 Park Ave S, New York, NYFrench bistro food, expensive but sooooo good.

properties.name: Rose's Turn
properties.description: Posted by Jenniever 55 Grove Street, New York, NY 10014A great (but tiny) piano bar in the west village - all the waitstaff know how to seriously sing and drinks aren\'t crazy expensive.

properties.name: South Ferry
properties.description: Posted by JennieverStaten Island Ferry will take you by the Statue of Liberty (although it won\'t stop) - it saves a ton of money on the more expensive toursit cruises leaving a block away from Battery Park.

properties.name: The Cloisters
properties.description: Posted by Jenniever  Fort Tryon Park, New York, NYA french monastary plopped into upper Manhattan. It\'s gorgeous, and the views will make you think you\'re nowhere near a city.

properties.name: The Jersey Shore
properties.description: Posted by Jennieverpoint pleasant Beach, New JerseyA Day at the beach is a given - even if you come off-season.

properties.name: The Metropolitain Museum of Art
properties.description: Posted by Jenniever 1000 5th Avenue, New York, NYIt\'s a big art museum. What can I say? It\'s worth seeing, even just for a little bit.

properties.name: Wolfgang Puck Express
properties.description: Posted by Jenniever Cheap eats on the water - You can see the lower-manhattan skyline from your table with your 0 pizza.
